measured_by: one-item risk-taking tendency scale (Dohmen et al., 2011)
justification: “To compare risks taken in the story to real-life risk-taking behaviours, we used three different instruments. The first instrument is the one-item risk-taking tendency scale used by Dohmen et al. (2011)… Participants were asked ‘are you generally a person who is fully prepared to take risks…’”
“The second instrument is the French version of the Domain-Specific Risk-Taking scale (Dospert, Blais & Weber, 2006)… This 30 items scale assess projected risk-taking on five different domains.”

“The last instrument was a self-report risk-taking questionnaire that was specifically built to mirror the risk-taking behaviours available during the interactive novel. This questionnaire asked the participant's frequency of taking 8 specific risk-taking behaviours during the last six months.”

measured_by: choices made within the interactive novel (choose-your-own-adventure task)
justification: “We created a 8000 words interactive novel… Every choice made by the participants during the flow of the story was recorded… using choices in interactive novel as a measure of risk-taking.”
